ygData.subject: Re: HTMLExtractor
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello Gordan, I found a (quick and dirty?) workaround: I changed nameserver entry of  /etc/resolv.conf and I am now using a nameserver located in the US:

Hello Gordan,

I found a (quick and dirty?) workaround: I changed nameserve=
r entry of  /etc/resolv.conf and I am now using a nameserver located in the=
 US:
nameserver 204.152.184.76

It seems to work (heritrix found all links)=
.

Best regards
 Christian


--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "hipch=
ristian" <hipchristian@...> wrote:
>
> Hello Gordan,
> 
> I did some experi=
ences with web http-header-check tool where the http-header-check server wa=
s located in the US. It seems that xing servers in US and Germany react dif=
ferently (see below). The server located in Germany (IP: 62.96.140.140) onl=
y delivers gzip-content.
> See also: http://www.websitepulse.com/help/testt=
ools.httpheaders-test.html (here you can choose requests from Germany, Aust=
ralia and the US).
> 
> And worse, even if I try to sent in the request htt=
p header an void accept-encoding (or identity) like: 
> wget --header=3D'ac=
cept-encoding: identity' -S http://www.xing.com/de/directories/people/
> I =
get an Http ERROR 406: Not Acceptable in the http-header reponse from the g=
erman xing server.
> 
> Unfortunately requesting an server in the US link 9=
6.7.20.25/de/directories/people/index.html.gz didn't work too (why??).
> 
>=
 It seems there is no way for me to use heritrix out of the box for crawlin=
g xing.com/de/directories/people/ from Germany. Or do you have any suggesti=
ons (e.g. using a proyx, which decompresses the pages)  
> 
> Best regards,=
 
>   Christian
